title: Door-to-door jabs not possible under rules, says Centre to Bombay HC | Mumbai News - Times of India
author: TNN; Apr
description: The Central ministry of health and family welfare informed Bombay high court on Wednesday that door-to-door Covid-19 vaccination is not possible or pe.
cleaned_text: The Central ministry of health and family welfare informed [Bombay high court](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/bombay-high-court) on Wednesday that door-to-door Covid-19 [vaccination](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/vaccination) is not possible or permissible under the current guidelines and protocols, as enforcing such a policy would pose challenges in ensuring observation of beneficiaries for 30 minutes after the jab. There would also be a risk of "high vaccine wastage". In an affidavit to a PIL filed by two Mumbai lawyers, Dhruti Kapadia and another, seeking doorstep vaccination for the very elderly and the specially abled, the ministry stated there may also be an increased risk of "contamination and exposure beyond recommended temperature which could affect vaccine efficacy and cause adverse events following immunisation, which will be detrimental to vaccine confidence and programme performance." Meanwhile, state Congress president Nana Patole on Wednesday had requested chief minister Uddhav Thackeray to immediately launch a door-to-door vaccination
